function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of certainty in the effectiveness of non-pharmaceutical interventions in countries at earlier stages of the epidemic.","Impact":"Potential for higher transmission and increased mortality in countries at earlier stages of the epidemic.","Mitigation":"Conduct ongoing monitoring and evaluation of interventions, and adapt strategies based on new data and insights.","Technologies":"Data analytics, modeling, and forecasting tools for epidemic trends.","People":"Populations in countries at earlier stages of the epidemic.","Owner":"Health authorities and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Reliance on semi-mechanistic approach with parameters estimated empirically and with strong prior distributions or fixed assumptions.","Impact":"Risk of inaccurate estimations and flawed understanding of infection dynamics.","Mitigation":"Regular update of estimates based on new data, improvement of parameter estimation methods, and validation against empirical evidence.","Technologies":"Advanced statistical and epidemiological modeling techniques and data analysis tools.","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, and public health researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions and public health agencies."},{"Description":"Influence of specific parameter choices (e.g., serial interval distribution, infection fatality ratio) on the estimated number of true underlying cases.","Impact":"Potential for bias and misinterpretation of the true magnitude of the epidemic.","Mitigation":"Transparency in the choice of parameters, validation of parameter choices against multiple sources of evidence, and sensitivity analysis of parameter influence on estimates.","Technologies":"Sensitivity analysis tools, validation frameworks, and reporting tools for parameter choices.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and policy makers.","Owner":"Public health research institutions and advisory bodies."}]}
